strings.Value: [Flick both on the forehead jokingly] "Your sins have been absolved. Now let's forget about it!"
"Now we are together — that's what's important."
"Did you not forget we have a campaign and probably more than one battle ahead? Stop talking, time to go!"

{n}You, Octavia, and Regongar were so busy last night that you barely got any sleep. In the morning, Octavia walks out of the tent, stretching.{/n} "Ah... That is the life! {Name}, Reg, you have no idea how much I love you. What idiots we were to fight, be suspicious, and try to upset each other... when I think how I was messing with your heads, with all the tests and problems for no reason, I just want to go back in time and give myself a thump on the head."

"It wasn't for no reason. If someone needs a thump on the head, it's me. It was me who was winding you up, remember? I was imagining you didn't need me, that you were trying to get rid of me... And I ended up just scaring you and actually turning you against me!"

"I'm afraid to remember it. We almost broke up back then. Imagine — we survived {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g}, and when we got free, we almost threw everything away. It's good that {Name} was around to talk some sense into us!"
"No, no, we need to remember — so we never do it again."

"You see... We had to grow up and learn to survive so early, we never got a chance to just learn to live. Now we have to go through all the bumps and bruises that the others get past while they're still young. So... Don't judge us!"
"Yes, of course. I got carried away, sorry!"
"We could chat a little. Our enemies aren't going to get away from us. And the road has waited for us a thousand years. It can wait a bit longer... But fine, fine, I'm ready. Let's go."
"Right. But knowing myself... I'm afraid it's just a matter of time before I do something else stupid."

{n}Octavia touches Reg's shoulder.{/n} "I always felt you were trying to tie me down, and own me... And all you really wanted was to belong to me. To know that I won't leave you. You said it so many times, but I didn't listen."

{n}The half-orc nods.{/n} "And I didn't listen to you. You wouldn't have had any reason to doubt me, if I didn't behave like a complete idiot." {n}He turns to you.{/n} "And without you we would probably have never understood each other. We'd still be fighting — or maybe even... Ugh, I don't even want to think about it!"
